topic: North Korea nuclear test readiness and likelihood
summary: NK technically ready since 2022 but no visible preparations; multiple previous questions resolved No; 3-month window to May 2026
content: Key findings: 1) Tunnel No. 3 at Punggye-ri has been ready since mid-2022. 2) South Korea DIA assessed Nov 2025 that NK could test on short notice - only Kim's political decision remains. 3) No satellite imagery shows imminent preparations (no instruments, cables, vehicles). 4) NK focus in late 2025/early 2026 is on missiles, submarine, delivery systems. 5) Kim announcing plans to bolster nuclear deterrent at upcoming party congress. 6) Trump has signaled willingness for engagement. 7) NK-Russia relationship is strong. 8) Historical base rate: 6 tests in 225 months (~2.7%/mo) but 0 tests in ~100 months since Sept 2017 moratorium. 9) Multiple Metaculus questions on NK nuclear test have resolved No.
